Class Mole

  • java.lang.Object
    • GameObject
      • Mole
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Dean, Girl, Professor

    public abstract class Mole
extends GameObject
    This class defines the basic structure of a Mole, which are owned by the PlayingField class. A Mole is a type of GameObject that is seen in the program as the Professors and Deans that pop up from behind the PlayingField's Seats.

      static int LIFESTATE_DEAD
      A constant assigned to this mole's lifeState member variable which indicates that the mole has either completed an entire life cycle and needs to be re-spawned or that the mole was smashed by a mallet
      static int LIFESTATE_FALLING
      A constant assigned to this mole's lifeState member variable which indicates that the Mole is retreating back behind the Seat
      static int LIFESTATE_RISING
      A constant assigned to this mole's lifeState member variable which indicates that that it is currently emerging from behind a Seat
      static int LIFESTATE_UP
      A constant assigned to this mole's lifeState member variable which indicates that this Mole has finished rising and is staying up for a while.
      static int LIFESTATE_WAITING
      A constant assigned to this mole's lifeState member variable which indicates that the mole has been spawned and is currently hiding behind a Seat before rising up from behind it.
      static float RISE_AND_FALL_VELOCITY
      A constant which determines the rate at which the Mole rises and falls

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Mole()
      Sets this Mole to the first lifeState, assigns it a riseAndFallTime, creates its transform, places its location at (-1, -1,) in the world and sets its seatMoleIsAt member variable to null.

    • Field Detail

      • LIFESTATE_DEAD

        public static final int LIFESTATE_DEAD
        A constant assigned to this mole's lifeState member variable which indicates that the mole has either completed an entire life cycle and needs to be re-spawned or that the mole was smashed by a mallet
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • LIFESTATE_WAITING

        public static final int LIFESTATE_WAITING
        A constant assigned to this mole's lifeState member variable which indicates that the mole has been spawned and is currently hiding behind a Seat before rising up from behind it.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • LIFESTATE_RISING

        public static final int LIFESTATE_RISING
        A constant assigned to this mole's lifeState member variable which indicates that that it is currently emerging from behind a Seat
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • LIFESTATE_UP

        public static final int LIFESTATE_UP
        A constant assigned to this mole's lifeState member variable which indicates that this Mole has finished rising and is staying up for a while.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        public static final int LIFESTATE_FALLING
        A constant assigned to this mole's lifeState member variable which indicates that the Mole is retreating back behind the Seat
        See Also:

        A constant which determines the rate at which the Mole rises and falls

    • Constructor Detail

      • Mole

        public Mole()
        Sets this Mole to the first lifeState, assigns it a riseAndFallTime, creates its transform, places its location at (-1, -1,) in the world and sets its seatMoleIsAt member variable to null.

    • Method Detail

      • update

        public void update(long elapsedTime)
        Handles the update logic depending upon what state the Mole is currently in.
        Overrides:
        update in class GameObject
        Parameters:
        elapsedTime - the amount of time in milliseconds that has passed since the last iteration.

      • setRandomLocation

        public void setRandomLocation()
        Sets the Mole's location on the PlayingField grid by setting two of this mole's member variables, gridX and gridY. This method should be called only through the PlayingField API because only the playingField is capable of managing selection conflicts.

      • makeAlive

        public void makeAlive()
        Sets the mole's lifeState to LIFESTATE_WAITING

      • kill

        public void kill()
        Removes the mole from its current seat, sets its grid coordinates to -1's, sets its Transform's velocity to 0 and its transform location to (-1,-1)

      • getLifeState

        public int getLifeState()
        Returns:
        returns current life state which can be any of the following:

        • 0, LIFESTATE_DEAD: the Mole has finished a life cycle or has been struck
        • 1, LIFESTATE_WAITING: the Mole is hiding behind a Seat
        • 2, LIFESTATE_RISING: the Mole is rising above a Seat
        • 3, LIFESTATE_UP: the Mole is stationary above the Seat
        • 4, LIFESTATE_FALLING: the Mole is returning to behind the Seat

      • getGridX

        public int getGridX()
        Returns:
        returns the horizontal component of which Seat the Mole is at

      • getGridY

        public int getGridY()
        Returns:
        returns the vertical component of which Seat the Mole is at

      • setSeatMoleIsAt

        public void setSeatMoleIsAt(Seat seat)
        Sets this Mole to belong at the Seat passed in as a parameter
        Parameters:
        the - seat the Mole will be set to sit at

      • getSeatMoleIsAt

        public Seat getSeatMoleIsAt()
        Returns:
        returns the Seat this Mole is currently sitting at

      • removeMoleFromSeat

        public void removeMoleFromSeat()
        Empties the Seat this Mole is currently sitting at and then sets this current mole's pointer to the Seat that was just emptied to null

      • generateRandomBoundedBy

        protected static float generateRandomBoundedBy(float lower,
                                               float upper)
        Parameters:
        lower - the lower-bound of the random number to be generated
        upper - the upper-bound of the random number to be generated
        Returns:
        returns a random number bounded by the parameters passed into the function
